original_fears: Social anxiety in large lecture halls
current_fears: Roommate is always busy, making it hard to find time to practice presentations together
Upcoming presentation in a large lecture hall causing freeze-up
current_challenges: Juggling heavy course load and internship search
Attending biology club mixer while preparing for presentation
current_behaviors: Planning to visit tutoring center for presentation help

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Zachary discussed feeling overwhelmed by a heavy course load, internship search, and anxiety about an upcoming presentation in a large lecture hall. Solutions offered included practicing presentations in smaller steps (recording self, using tutoring center) and preparing conversation starters/exit strategies for networking. Zachary positively responded by committing to three practice recordings and planning to try exit strategies at a biology club mixer. Evidence of progress includes scheduled practice sessions and a plan to utilize campus resources.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Presentation anxiety in large lecture halls, networking difficulties, and finding practice partners. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Gradual exposure practice through self-recording, utilizing campus resources, preparing conversation starters and exit strategies. 3) Student's response to solutions: Positive engagement with recording approach, commitment to three practice sessions, and plan to use tutoring center. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Concrete practice schedule established, awareness of campus resources, and planned application of networking strategies at upcoming event.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Zachary discussed his anxiety about an upcoming presentation in a large lecture hall and difficulties with networking. Solutions offered included practicing presentations through self-recording and utilizing campus tutoring resources, as well as preparing conversation starters and exit strategies for networking events. Zachary responded positively, committing to three practice recordings and planning to try exit strategies at a biology club mixer. Evidence of progress includes his structured plan for presentation practice and willingness to apply networking tips in real situations.
